page.title: 09TRANSPORT-SILK MILLS SIG BOX
page.content: Part of the London-Penzance Railway is in our area and it crosses the Silk Mills Road which is a fairly major road leading out of Taunton. There there are automatic barriers controlled by the signalman who is in the signal box beside the track.This signal box,due to cuts by British Rail,is soon to be one of many signal boxes which are to be demolished,and this stretch of line is to be controlled by a signal box at Exeter, further down the line. Trains come down this line about 70 times a day,and they are mostly passenger trains.The engines are usually HST's (High Speed Trains) although we do see diesels pulling goods trains.
